TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SKPathMeasure extends SkiaSharp.SKObject

Docs.summary: Represents a type that can be used to calculate the length of, and segments of, a path.

MemberSignature.Value: public SKPathMeasure ();
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Create a new instance with a null path.

MemberSignature.Value: public SKPathMeasure (SkiaSharp.SKPath path, bool forceClosed = false, float resScale = 1);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class SkiaSharp.SKPath path, bool forceClosed, float32 resScale) cil managed

Docs.param: The path to use, or null.
Controls whether or not the path is treated as closed.
Controls the precision of the measure. Values greater 1 increase the precision (and possibly slow down the computation).
Docs.summary: Create a new instance with the specified path.
Docs.remarks: The path must remain valid for the lifetime of the measure object, or until is called with a different path (or null), since the measure object keeps a reference to the path object (does not copy its data).

Docs.param: To be added.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("Use GetMatrix(float, out SKMatrix, SKPathMeasureMatrixFlags) instead.", true)

Docs.param: The distance to use.
The computed matrix.
Flags to indicate how to compute the matrix.
Docs.summary: Computes a from the specified distance along the path.
Docs.returns: Returns false if there is no path, or a zero-length path was specified, in which case matrix is unchanged.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool GetPosition (float distance, out SkiaSharp.SKPoint position);
.method public hidebysig instance bool GetPosition(float32 distance, [out] valuetype SkiaSharp.SKPoint& position) cil managed

Docs.param: The distance to use.
The position of a point along the current contour.
Docs.summary: Computes the corresponding position from the specified distance along the path.
Docs.returns: Returns false if there is no path, or a zero-length path was specified, in which case position is unchanged.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool GetPositionAndTangent (float distance, out SkiaSharp.SKPoint position, out SkiaSharp.SKPoint tangent);
.method public hidebysig instance bool GetPositionAndTangent(float32 distance, [out] valuetype SkiaSharp.SKPoint& position, [out] valuetype SkiaSharp.SKPoint& tangent) cil managed

Docs.param: The distance to use.
The position of a point along the current contour.
The tangent along the current contour.
Docs.summary: Computes the corresponding position and tangent from the specified distance along the path.
Docs.returns: Returns false if there is no path, or a zero-length path was specified, in which case position and tangent are unchanged.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool GetSegment (float start, float stop, SkiaSharp.SKPath dst, bool startWithMoveTo);
.method public hidebysig instance bool GetSegment(float32 start, float32 stop, class SkiaSharp.SKPath dst, bool startWithMoveTo) cil managed

Docs.param: The starting offset of the segment.
The end offset of the segment.
The path to hold the new segment.
If true, begin the path segment with a .
Docs.summary: Given a start and stop distance, update the destination path with the intervening segment(s).
Docs.returns: Returns false if the segment is zero-length, otherwise returns true.
Docs.remarks: The start and stop parameters are pinned to 0...

Docs.param: The distance to use.
The tangent along the current contour.
Docs.summary: Computes the corresponding tangent from the specified distance along the path.
Docs.returns: Returns false if there is no path, or a zero-length path was specified, in which case position and tangent are unchanged.

Docs.summary: Gets the total length of the current contour, or 0 if no path is associated.
Docs.value: The total length of the current contour.

Docs.summary: Move to the next contour in the path.
Docs.returns: Returns true if another one exists, otherwise false.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetPath (SkiaSharp.SKPath path, bool forceClosed);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetPath(class SkiaSharp.SKPath path, bool forceClosed) cil managed

Docs.param: The path to use, or null.
Controls whether or not the path is treated as closed.
Docs.summary: Reset the path measure with the specified path.
Docs.remarks: The path must remain valid for the lifetime of the measure object, or until is called with a different path (or null), since the measure object keeps a reference to the path object (does not copy its data).
